moves: 1. d4 e6 2. e4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e5 Nfd7 6. h4
comment: The Chatard-Alekhine attack: a sharp weapon against the French Defense.

moves: 1. d4 e6 2. e4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e5 Nfd7 6. h4 c5 7. Qg4
comment:
Theory advices 7.Bxe7.
Lilienthal, with the move in the text, preferres a poisoned continuation.
Afterward Paul Keres stopped any discussion on the subject with his
declaration: "After 7.Qg4 White is better." Full stop. Now Black must do his
steps very carefully.

moves: 1. d4 e6 2. e4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e5 Nfd7 6. h4 c5 7. Qg4 f5
comment:
Lilienthal: "Afterward, during the Second
International Tournament in Moscow, Vera Menchik, in the same position, played
against me 7... Nc6 but after 8. Bxe7 Kxe7 9. Qg5+ Kf8 10. Qxd8+ Nxd8 11. f4 I
had advantage."  Preferable to Spielmann's move is however 7... Kf8 with the
possible continuation 8. Nf3 Nc6 9. Qf4 cxd4 10. Nb5 a6 11. Nbxd4 Nc5

moves: 1. d4 e6 2. e4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e5 Nfd7 6. h4 c5 7. Qg4 f5 8. Qh5+ g6 9. Qh6 Bf8
comment:
There is nothing better!  After 9... Bxg5 10. hxg5 White
threatens Qh6-g7 and Nc3-b5.

moves: 1. d4 e6 2. e4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e5 Nfd7 6. h4 c5 7. Qg4 f5 8. Qh5+ g6 9. Qh6 Bf8 10. Bxd8 Bxh6 11. Bg5 Bxg5 12. hxg5 a6 13. f4 cxd4 14. Nce2 Nc6 15. Nf3 d3 16. cxd3 Nc5 17. Kd2

1. d4 e6 2. e4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e5 Nfd7 6. h4 c5 7. Qg4 f5 8. Qh5+ g6 9. Qh6 Bf8 10. Bxd8 Bxh6 11. Bg5 Bxg5 12. hxg5 a6 13. f4 cxd4 14. Nce2 Nc6 15. Nf3 d3 16. cxd3 Nc5 17. Kd2 Bd7 18. Rc1 b6 19. Ned4 Nxd4 20. Nxd4 a5 21. Be2 O-O 22. Ke3 Rac8 23. g4 fxg4 24. Rhg1 Rf7 25. Bxg4
comment:
?!  With this move Lilienthal loses his advantage. 
Stronger and perhaps decisive was 25. Rxg4 and if 25... Rcf8 then 26. Rh4 with
the idea of calling the Knight to help with the maneuver Nd4-f3-h2-g4.

moves: 1. d4 e6 2. e4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e5 Nfd7 6. h4 c5 7. Qg4 f5 8. Qh5+ g6 9. Qh6 Bf8 10. Bxd8 Bxh6 11. Bg5 Bxg5 12. hxg5 a6 13. f4 cxd4 14. Nce2 Nc6 15. Nf3 d3 16. cxd3 Nc5 17. Kd2 Bd7 18. Rc1 b6 19. Ned4 Nxd4 20. Nxd4 a5 21. Be2 O-O 22. Ke3 Rac8 23. g4 fxg4 24. Rhg1 Rf7 25. Bxg4 Rcf8
comment: Spielmann does not lose this opportunity.
